prop.head.headtext: Handling Cases Before the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation

para.paratext: The Panel requires that a party initiating transfer provide it with a schedule of every action involved in the litigation.[1] The schedule must contain the complete (not shortened to first-named parties or by use of “et al.”) name of each action, the district court in which it is pending, the civil action number, and the name of the judge assigned to that action, if known. This schedule is used by the Clerk to prepare the service list used by ECF to effect service on all parties and is important to the smooth operation of the litigation. The schedule is also used as an appendix to many Panel decisions to identify the actions being ruled on. A sample form of schedule of actions is included in Appendix A. Although not expressly required, the ideal format of the schedule of actions is in ascending alphabetical order of district courts (by state, then district) and then ascending case number order within each district. This permits the Panel to construct the service list in the most orderly manner.
Maslon Edelman Borman & Brand, LLP, Minneapolis, Minnesota.
J.P.M.L. R. 6.1(b)(ii). The Panel rules are reproduced in § 4:34.
